page.title: 01ST.WENN : A RURAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: St.Wenn is situated in a rural landscape of{fields,woods and {streams. The rolling landscape is punctuated by well cultivated valleys that are mostly grass or rotated crops. Valley bottoms are frequently very damp and there are many small pockets of woodland. Isolated{farms}lie at the ends of long twisting lanes and the small fields and frequent hegderows create a green checker-board scene. Small communities,like{Withiel}and {St.Wenn}are build up around the{church and{school.}Some homes are owned by Cornish folk and others by people who have moved to the area.One or two have been converted into{holiday homes. The farms are often owned by related families and have been in the same family for many generations.
